com.camerontec.catalys.util.logger.logback

Class HighPerformanceLoggerAppender

  • java.lang.Object
    • <any>
      • com.camerontec.catalys.util.logger.logback.HighPerformanceLoggerAppender

  • public class HighPerformanceLoggerAppender
extends <any>
    A logback style appender which allows for combined usage of logback and HPL in a single server.

    This implementation assumes that the server is configured to log using logback (by explicitly disabling HPL via its configuration file), but that it is still desirable to be able to use HPL in order to stream logs to the MIS without having to configure the server as an LMA guest application. The cost is, of course, disk space because logs are duplicated to the HPL log file.

    Logback appenders are instantiated early in the server lifecycle so this implementation makes no assumptions about startup ordering. That is, it handles JMX registration failures by retrying when it can.

    It is sufficient for there to be a single instance of this class only since there is only single HPL appender and we only want to register with JMX once. Therefore this class is implemented as a monostate. As a consequence there may be any number of instances configured and therefore created by logback, but they all append via the single HPL appender.

    It is safe for multiple threads to concurrently append log events via instances of this class.
